sen.j: 須恵器（すえき）は、日本で古墳時代から平安時代まで生産された陶質土器である。
sen.e: Sueki is earthenware which was produced during periods from Kofun to Heian in Japan.
Sueki is earthenware which was produced during periods from Kofun to Heian in Japan.
Sueki is earthenware which was produced during periods from Kofun to Heian in Japan.

sen.j: 青灰色で硬い。
sen.e: The color is blue-gray and it is hard.
The color is blue-gray and it is hard.
The color is blue-gray and it is hard.

sen.j: 同時期の土師器とは色と質で明瞭に区別できるが、一部に中間的なものもある。
sen.e: It is easily-distinguishable from the contemporary Haji ware by its color and quality, but some are intermediate between the two.
It is easily-distinguishable from the contemporary Haji ware by its color and quality, but some are intermediate between the two.
It is easily-distinguishable from the contemporary Haji ware by its color and quality, but some are intermediate between the two.

sen.j: 5世紀に朝鮮半島南部から伝わり、土師器より高級な品として扱われた。
sen.e: Sueki was brought to Japan from the south of Korean Peninsula and was treated as more luxurious pottery than Haji pottery.
Sueki was brought to Japan from the south of Korean Peninsula and was treated as more luxurious pottery than Haji pottery.
Sueki was brought to Japan from the south of Korean Peninsula and was treated as more luxurious pottery than Haji pottery.

sen.j: 平安時代には「陶器」と書いて「すえもの」「すえうつわもの」と読まれていたが、それが古墳時代に遡るかはわからない。
sen.e: The kanji for earthenware "陶器" was read "Suemono" or "Sueutsuwamono" during Heian period but it is unknown that it goes back to the Kofun period.
The kanji for earthenware "陶器" was read "Suemono" or "Sueutsuwamono" during Heian period but it is unknown that it goes back to the Kofun period.
The kanji for earthenware '陶器' was read 'Suemono' or 'Sueutsuwamono' during Heian period but it is unknown that it goes back to the Kofun period.

sen.j: 陶器（とうき）と混乱を避けるため、現代の考古学用語としては須恵器が一般化している。
sen.e: In order to avoid confusion with 陶器 which is read "Toki" meaning earthenware nowadays, the archaeological term "Sueki" is commonly used.
sen.cmt: 「陶器」の現代用法に関して多少注釈を入れて訳しました。
sen.e: In order to avoid confusion with 陶器 which is read "Toki" meaning earthenware nowadays, the archaeological term "Sueki" is commonly used.
In order to avoid confusion with 陶器 which is read "Toki" meaning earthenware nowadays, the archaeological term "Sueki" is commonly used.

sen.j: 20世紀前半までは祝部土器（いわいべどき）と呼ばれることがあった。
sen.e: Sueki was sometimes called "Iwaibedoki," which meant celebration earthenware, until the former half of the 20th century.
Sueki was sometimes called "Iwaibedoki," which meant celebration earthenware, until the former half of the 20th century.
Sueki was sometimes called "Iwaibedoki," which meant celebration earthenware, until the former half of the 20th century.

sen.j: 須恵器の起源は朝鮮半島（特に、その南部の伽耶）にあり、初期の須恵器は半島のものと区別をつけにくいほど似ている。
sen.e: Sueki originated in Korean Peninsula (especially in Kaya which was in the south of the peninsula), and early Sueki looks so similar to the one created in the peninsula that it is hard to distinguish between the two.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Sueki originated in Korean Peninsula (especially in Kaya which was in the south of the peninsula), and early Sueki looks so similar to the one created in the peninsula that it is hard to distinguish between the two.

Sueki originated in Korean Peninsula (especially in Kaya which was in the south of the peninsula), and early Sueki looks so similar to the one created in the peninsula that it is hard to distinguish between the two.

sen.j: しかし、用語としては日本で製作された還元焔焼成の硬質の焼物だけを須恵器という。
sen.e: However, the term "Sueki" refers to only hard earthenware created in Japan and fired in an oxygen-reduction atmosphere.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: However, the term "Sueki" refers to only hard earthenware created in Japan and fired in an oxygen-reduction atmosphere.
However, the term "Sueki" refers to only hard earthenware created in Japan and fired in an oxygen-reduction atmosphere.

sen.j: 朝鮮半島のものは、普通名詞的に陶質土器と呼ばれるか、伽耶土器・新羅土器・百済土器などもう少し細分した名で呼ばれている。
sen.e: The earthenware created in Korean Peninsula goes by just "earthenware" as a common name or by slightly more subdivided names such as Kaya ware, Silla ware and Baekje ware.
The earthenware created in Korean Peninsula goes by just "earthenware" as a common name or by slightly more subdivided names such as Kaya ware, Silla ware and Baekje ware.
The earthenware created in Korean Peninsula goes by just "earthenware" as a common name or by slightly more subdivided names such as Kaya ware, Silla ware and Baekje ware.

sen.j: 土師器までの土器が日本列島固有の特徴（紐状の粘土を積み上げる）を色濃く残しているのに対し、須恵器は全く異なる技術（ろくろ技術）を用いて製作された。
sen.e: Whereas the ancient pottery including Haji pottery was made with clear characteristics of stacking up ring-shaped clays which was unique to Japanese archipelago, Sueki was made using the potter's wheel which was a completely different technique.

Whereas the ancient pottery including Haji pottery was made with clear characteristics of stacking up ring-shaped clays which was unique to Japanese archipelago, Sueki was made using the potter's wheel which was a completely different technique.

Whereas the ancient pottery including Haji pottery was made with clear characteristics of stacking up ring-shaped clays which was unique to Japanese archipelago, Sueki was made using the potter's wheel which was a completely different technique.

sen.j: それまでの土器は野焼きで作られていた。
sen.e: Earthenware before Sueki was made having been fired on the ground uncovered.
Earthenware before Sueki was made having been fired on the ground uncovered.
Earthenware before Sueki was made having been fired on the ground uncovered.

sen.j: このため焼成温度（800～900度）が低く、強度があまりなかった。
sen.e: Therefore, the firing temperature was as low as 800 to 900 degrees C and the earthenware was not very hard.
Therefore, the firing temperature was as low as 800 to 900 degrees C and the earthenware was not very hard.
Therefore, the firing temperature was as low as 800 to 900 degrees C and the earthenware was not very hard.

sen.j: また、酸化焔焼成（酸素が充分に供給される焼成法）となったため、表面の色は赤みを帯びた。
sen.e: In addition, since it was fired in an oxygen-rich atmosphere, it was reddish in color on the surface.
In addition, since it was fired in an oxygen-rich atmosphere, it was reddish in color on the surface.
In addition, since it was fired in an oxygen-rich atmosphere, it was reddish in color on the surface.

sen.j: それに対し、須恵器は窖窯（あながま）を用い1100度以上の高温で還元焔焼成する。
sen.e: On the contrary, Sueki was fired in Anagama kiln (a Japanese pottery kiln that utilizes wood ash to glaze pottery) at high temperatures of more than 1,100 degrees C in an oxygen-reduction atmosphere.
On the contrary, Sueki was fired in Anagama kiln (a Japanese pottery kiln that utilizes wood ash to glaze pottery) at high temperatures of more than 1,100 degrees C in an oxygen-reduction atmosphere.
On the contrary, Sueki was fired in Anagama kiln (a Japanese pottery kiln that utilizes wood ash to glaze pottery) at high temperatures of more than 1,100 degrees C in an oxygen-reduction atmosphere.

sen.j: 閉ざされた窖窯の中では酸素の供給が不足するが、高熱によって燃焼が進む。
sen.e: Although the oxygen supply runs short in a closed Anagama kiln, the firing proceeds by high temperature.
Although the oxygen supply runs short in a closed Anagama kiln, the firing proceeds by high temperature.
Although the oxygen supply runs short in a closed Anagama kiln, the firing proceeds by high temperature.

sen.j: 燃料からは、酸素が十分なら二酸化炭素と水になるところ、一酸化炭素と水素が発生する。
sen.e: If the oxygen supply is enough, the fuel turns into carbon dioxide and water, but the fuel turns into carbon monoxide and hydrogen in an oxygen-reduction atmosphere.
sen.cmt: わかりやすくするため「酸素が不足すると」の訳を入れた。
sen.e: If the oxygen supply is enough, the fuel turns into carbon dioxide and water, but the fuel turns into carbon monoxide and hydrogen in an oxygen-reduction atmosphere.
If the oxygen supply is enough, the fuel turns into carbon dioxide and water, but the fuel turns into carbon monoxide and hydrogen in an oxygen-reduction atmosphere.

sen.j: これが粘土の成分にある酸化物から酸素を奪う、つまりは還元することで二酸化炭素と水になる。
sen.e: These deprive oxide in the clay of oxygen, which is reduction, and turn into carbon dioxide and water.
These deprive oxide in the clay of oxygen, which is reduction, and turn into carbon dioxide and water.
These deprive oxide in the clay of oxygen, which is reduction, and turn into carbon dioxide and water.

sen.j: 特徴的な色は、粘土中の赤い酸化第二鉄が還元されて酸化第一鉄に変質するために現れる。
sen.e: The characteristic color emerges when red ferric oxide in the clay changes into ferrous oxide through reduction.
The characteristic color emerges when red ferric oxide in the clay changes into ferrous oxide through reduction.
The characteristic color emerges when red ferric oxide in the clay changes into ferrous oxide through reduction.

sen.j: 高温土器生産の技術は、中国江南地域に始まり、朝鮮半島に伝えられた。
sen.e: The technique to produce earthenware with high temperature originated in Jiangnan area of China and was conveyed to Korean Peninsula.
The technique to produce earthenware with high temperature originated in Jiangnan area of China and was conveyed to Korean Peninsula.
The technique to produce earthenware with high temperature originated in Jiangnan area of China and was conveyed to Korean Peninsula.

sen.j: 『日本書紀』には、百済などからの渡来人が製作したの記述がある一方、紀元前1世紀頃、垂仁天皇（垂仁3年）の時代に新羅王子アメノヒボコとその従者として須恵器の工人がやってきたとも記されている。
sen.e: In the Nihonshoki (Chronicles of Japan), it is written that Sueki was made by toraijin (settlers) and in the meantime, it is also written that the Sueki craftsman visited Japan as a follower of the Prince of Silla Amenohiboko around the first century B.C. during the reign of Emperor Suinin.

In the Nihonshoki (Chronicles of Japan), it is written that Sueki was made by toraijin (settlers) and in the meantime, it is also written that the Sueki craftsman visited Japan as a follower of the Prince of Silla Amenohiboko around the first century B.C. during the reign of Emperor Suinin.

In the Nihonshoki (Chronicles of Japan), it is written that Sueki was made by toraijin (settlers) and in the meantime, it is also written that the Sueki craftsman visited Japan as a follower of the Prince of Silla Amenohiboko around the first century B.C. during the reign of Emperor Suinin.

sen.j: そのため新羅系須恵器（若しくは陶質土器）が伝播していた可能性が否定しきれない。
sen.e: For that reason, it is unable to deny the possibility that Silla-group Sueki (or earthenware) was spread.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: For that reason, the possibility that Silla-group Sueki (or earthenware) was spread cannot be denied.
sen.cmt: unableの使用方法が不自然だったため修正しました。
sen.e: For that reason, the possibility that Silla-group Sueki (or earthenware) was spread cannot be denied.

sen.j: しかし、現在のところ、この記述と関係が深いと思われる滋賀県竜王町の鏡谷窯跡群や天日矛が住んだといわれる旧但馬地方でも初期の須恵器は確認されていない。
sen.e: However, at present, early Sueki was not found at Kagamiyama ruins of old kilns in Ryuocho, Shiga Prefecture, which is closely-linked to this description, or either in Tajima region where Amenohiboko is said to have lived.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。 原文中の固有名詞の「鏡谷」は「鏡山」の間違いだと思われます。
sen.e: However, at present, early Sueki was not found at Kagamiyama ruins of old kilns in Ryuocho, Shiga Prefecture, which is closely-linked to this description, or either in Tajima region where Amenohiboko is said to have lived.

However, at present, early Sueki was not found at Kagamiyama ruins of old kilns in Ryuocho, Shiga Prefecture, which is closely-linked to this description, or either in Tajima region where Amenohiboko is said to have lived.

sen.j: 結局、この技術は百済から伽耶を経て日本列島に伝えられたと考えられている。
sen.e: Consequently, this technique is considered to have been conveyed from Baekje to Japan via Kaya.
Consequently, this technique is considered to have been conveyed from Baekje to Japan via Kaya.
Consequently, this technique is considered to have been conveyed from Baekje to Japan via Kaya.

sen.j: 考古学的には、須恵器の出現は古墳時代中期、5世紀中頃とされる。
sen.e: In the archaeological point of view, it is believed that people started to produce Sueki in the middle of the Kofun period, which is around mid-fifth century.
In the archaeological point of view, it is believed that people started to produce Sueki in the middle of the Kofun period, which is around mid-fifth century.
In the archaeological point of view, it is believed that people started to produce Sueki in the middle of the Kofun period, which is around mid-fifth century.

sen.j: 日本列島で最古の窯は大阪府堺市大庭寺窯跡である。
sen.e: The oldest kiln in Japan is Obadera ruins of kiln in Sakai City, Osaka Prefecture.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The oldest kiln in Japan is Obadera ruins of kiln in Sakai City, Osaka Prefecture.
The oldest kiln in Japan is Obadera ruins of kiln in Sakai City, Osaka Prefecture.

sen.j: 最初に須恵器生産が始まった場所（窯跡）として大阪府堺市南部、和泉市、大阪狭山市、岸和田市、にまたがる丘陵地帯に分布する陶邑窯跡群、福岡県の小隈・山隈・八並窯跡群が知られている。
sen.e: Suemura ruins of kilns spread in the foothills extending through southern area of Sakai City, Izumi City, Osaka-sayama City and Kishiwada City, and ruins of kilns at Koguma, Yamaguma and Yatsunami in Fukuoka Prefecture are known as places where Sueki production started first.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Suemura ruins of kilns spread in the foothills extending through southern area of Sakai City, Izumi City, Osaka-sayama City and Kishiwada City, and ruins of kilns at Koguma, Yamaguma and Yatsunami in Fukuoka Prefecture are known as places where Sueki production started first.

Suemura ruins of kilns spread in the foothills extending through southern area of Sakai City, Izumi City, Osaka-sayama City and Kishiwada City, and ruins of kilns at Koguma, Yamaguma and Yatsunami in Fukuoka Prefecture are known as places where Sueki production started first.

sen.j: また、吹田市吹田32号窯、岡山県奥ヶ谷窯跡、香川県宮山1号窯・三谷三郎池西岸窯跡、福岡県夜須町山隈窯跡などの初現期の窯跡も日本各地に造られる。
sen.e: Other early kilns were built all over Japan such as Suita 32nd kiln in Suita City, Okugatani kiln in Okayama Prefecture, Miyayama 1st kiln and Mitani-Saburo-Ike Seigan (west bank) kiln in Kagawa Prefecture and Yamaguma kiln in Yasumachi, Fukuoka Prefecture.
sen.cmt: 原文では「窯跡」が「造られる」となっており、意味がおかしくなるので、「跡」の部分は訳しませんでした。
sen.e: Other early kilns were built all over Japan such as Suita 32nd kiln in Suita City, Okugatani kiln in Okayama Prefecture, Miyayama 1st kiln and Mitani-Saburo-Ike Seigan (west bank) kiln in Kagawa Prefecture and Yamaguma kiln in Yasumachi, Fukuoka Prefecture.

Other early kilns were built all over Japan such as Suita 32nd kiln in Suita City, Okugatani kiln in Okayama Prefecture, Miyayama 1st kiln and Mitani-Saburo-Ike Seigan (west bank) kiln in Kagawa Prefecture and Yamaguma kiln in Yasumachi, Fukuoka Prefecture.

sen.j: これらの系譜は、いずれも伽耶系である。
sen.e: Pottery made in these kilns belong to Kaya ware group.
Pottery made in these kilns belong to Kaya ware group.
Pottery made in these kilns belong to Kaya ware group.

sen.j: このうち大阪府の陶邑窯跡群は日本列島最大であり、天皇陵を含むと考えられている百舌鳥古墳群と地理的に近接している。
sen.e: Among these ruins of kilns, Suemura ruins of kilns in Osaka Prefecture is the largest in Japan and is located close to Mozu burial mounds which is considered to have the Imperial mausoleum.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Among these ruins of kilns, Suemura ruins of kilns in Osaka Prefecture is the largest in Japan and is located close to Mozu burial mounds which is considered to have the Imperial mausoleum.
Among these ruins of kilns, Suemura ruins of kilns in Osaka Prefecture is the largest in Japan and is located close to Mozu burial mounds which is considered to have the Imperial mausoleum.

sen.j: そして、やがてヤマト王権の管理のもとで、同じ規格の製品を生産するよう統御されるようになったと考えられる。
sen.e: Suemura ruins of kilns are believed to have been controlled to produce the same standard of earthenware under Yamato sovereignty.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Suemura ruins of kilns are believed to have been controlled to produce the same standard of earthenware under Yamato sovereignty.
Suemura ruins of kilns are believed to have been controlled to produce the same standard of earthenware under Yamato sovereignty.

sen.j: そのような「品質管理」の状況を物語る遺跡として堺市の深田遺跡や小角田遺跡が挙げられる。
sen.e: Such "quality control" can be seen at Fukada Remains and Kokanda Remains in Sakai City.
Such "quality control" can be seen at Fukada Remains and Kokanda Remains in Sakai City.
Such 'quality control' can be seen at Fukada Remains and Kokanda Remains in Sakai City.

sen.j: 6世紀代に列島各地に須恵器窯が造られた。
sen.e: In the sixth century, kilns for Sueki were made in various locations in Japan.
In the sixth century, kilns for Sueki were made in various locations in Japan.
In the sixth century, kilns for Sueki were made in various locations in Japan.

sen.j: これらの須恵器窯で陶邑様式の須恵器が生産された。
sen.e: Suemura-type Sueki was produced in these Sueki kilns.
Suemura-type Sueki was produced in these Sueki kilns.
Suemura-type Sueki was produced in these Sueki kilns.

sen.j: このことを陶邑工人の地方拡散とみる説、在地工人が陶邑様式を受容して生産したとみる説とがある。
sen.e: By this fact, one theory holds that craftsmen to make Suemura-type Sueki spread out to local areas, whereas the other theory holds that craftsmen in local areas learned how to make Suemura-type Sueki and produced them.

By this fact, one theory holds that craftsmen to make Suemura-type Sueki spread out to local areas, whereas the other theory holds that craftsmen in local areas learned how to make Suemura-type Sueki and produced them.

By this fact, one theory holds that craftsmen to make Suemura-type Sueki spread out to local areas, whereas the other theory holds that craftsmen in local areas learned how to make Suemura-type Sueki and produced them.

sen.j: 微妙な地域差が見出せるものの、列島的規模での規格化の力が働いていることは確かである。
sen.e: Although there are slight regional differences, it is certain that the nationwide-scale standardization was implemented.
Although there are slight regional differences, it is certain that the nationwide-scale standardization was implemented.
Although there are slight regional differences, it is certain that the nationwide-scale standardization was implemented.

sen.j: このことから、須恵器生産においてヤマト王権が主導的役割を果たしていたと考えられる。
sen.e: Thus, it is considered that Yamato sovereignty was playing the major role in Sueki production.
Thus, it is considered that Yamato sovereignty was playing the major role in Sueki production.
Thus, it is considered that Yamato sovereignty was playing the major role in Sueki production.

sen.j: 古墳時代の須恵器は、主に祭祀や副葬品に用いられた。
sen.e: During the Kofun period, Sueki was used mainly for a religious service or as burial accessories.
During the Kofun period, Sueki was used mainly for a religious service or as burial accessories.
During the Kofun period, Sueki was used mainly for a religious service or as burial accessories.

sen.j: 初めのうち古墳からの出土に限られるが、普及が進んだ後期になると西日本で集落からも出土した。
sen.e: Early Sueki is unearthed only from tumuli, but later one can also be found in the remains of a village of western Japan since it was widely used.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Early Sueki is unearthed only from tumuli, but later one can also be found in the remains of a village of western Japan since it was widely used.
Early Sueki is unearthed only from tumuli, but later one can also be found in the remains of a village of western Japan since it was widely used.

sen.j: 西日本では須恵器、東日本では土師器が優勢という違いが現れた。
sen.e: The difference emerged that Sueki was dominant in western Japan and Haji ware was dominant in eastern Japan.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The difference emerged that Sueki was dominant in western Japan and Haji ware was dominant in eastern Japan.
The difference emerged that Sueki was dominant in western Japan and Haji ware was dominant in eastern Japan.

sen.j: 奈良時代以降になると、各地方で国分寺の瓦を焼成するために、瓦窯とともに須恵器焼成窯が造られるようになった。
sen.e: After the Nara period, people started to make kilns for Sueki along with kilns to make roof tiles of kokubunji (a status of the state-supported provincial temples) in various places.
After the Nara period, people started to make kilns for Sueki along with kilns to make roof tiles of kokubunji (a status of the state-supported provincial temples) in various places.
After the Nara period, people started to make kilns for Sueki along with kilns to make roof tiles of kokubunji (a status of the state-supported provincial temples) in various places.

sen.j: 国や郡の官衙での使用が柱にあったが、それだけに留まらず日常の器としても盛んに用いられるようになった。
sen.e: Sueki was used basically at the government office of a state or a county, but started to be used daily as serving dish as well.
Sueki was used basically at the government office of a state or a county, but started to be used daily as serving dish as well.
Sueki was used basically at the government office of a state or a county, but started to be used daily as serving dish as well.

sen.j: 埼玉県鳩山町及びその周辺に分布する南比企窯跡群は、その代表例である。
sen.e: Minamihiki ruins of kilns that are distributed around Hatoyama-machi of Saitama Prefecture represent those kilns.
Minamihiki ruins of kilns that are distributed around Hatoyama-machi of Saitama Prefecture represent those kilns.
Minamihiki ruins of kilns that are distributed around Hatoyama-machi of Saitama Prefecture represent those kilns.

sen.j: 須恵器生産は蝦夷に対峙する城柵の設置にともなって東北地方に達した。
sen.e: Production of Sueki reached Tohoku area along with building of an official defense site to confront Ezo (northerners).
Production of Sueki reached Tohoku area along with building of an official defense site to confront Ezo (northerners).
Production of Sueki reached Tohoku area along with building of an official defense site to confront Ezo (northerners).

sen.j: 平安時代には、これまで須恵器生産が盛んだった西日本で一郡一窯の体制から一国一窯への収斂がみられ、産地の数が減る傾向がでてきた。
sen.e: In the Heian period, the system changed from "one county one kiln" to "one country one kiln" in western Japan where Sueki production was active, which led decrease in production areas.
sen.cmt: 見やすくするため、一群一窯の訳は" "でくくりました。
sen.e: In the Heian period, the system changed from "one county one kiln" to "one country one kiln" in western Japan where Sueki production was active, which led decrease in production areas.
In the Heian period, the system changed from "one county one kiln" to "one country one kiln" in western Japan where Sueki production was active, which led decrease in production areas.

sen.j: 地方統治における郡の役割の低下と、国の役割の向上が背景にあるとも言われる。
sen.e: Behind this trend was the fact that a role of a county diminished on local governance and a country started to have a greater role.
Behind this trend was the fact that a role of a county diminished on local governance and a country started to have a greater role.
Behind this trend was the fact that a role of a county diminished on local governance and a country started to have a greater role.

sen.j: しかし辺境域の東日本では逆に生産地拡散の傾向がみられ、関東地方では新規の窯が増えた。
sen.e: However, in eastern Japan, which was a remote region, production areas tended to spread on the contrary and new kilns increased in Kanto region.
However, in eastern Japan, which was a remote region, production areas tended to spread on the contrary and new kilns increased in Kanto region.
However, in eastern Japan, which was a remote region, production areas tended to spread on the contrary and new kilns increased in Kanto region.

sen.j: 東北地方中部・南部でも奈良時代には少なかった須恵器が9世紀には盛んに製作された。
sen.e: Although Sueki was not produced very much in the middle and the south of Tohoku region in the Nara period, people started to produce it actively in the ninth century.
Although Sueki was not produced very much in the middle and the south of Tohoku region in the Nara period, people started to produce it actively in the ninth century.
Although Sueki was not produced very much in the middle and the south of Tohoku region in the Nara period, people started to produce it actively in the ninth century.

sen.j: それも9世紀末には衰退し、土師器系の土器にとってかわられる形で須恵器生産は10世紀に絶える。
sen.e: However, Sueki production declined at the end of the ninth century and ended in the tenth century replaced by earthenware that belongs to Haji ware group.
However, Sueki production declined at the end of the ninth century and ended in the tenth century replaced by earthenware that belongs to Haji ware group.
However, Sueki production declined at the end of the ninth century and ended in the tenth century replaced by earthenware that belongs to Haji ware group.

sen.j: 拡散の最遠は、9世紀末から10世紀にかけて操業した五所川原窯で、津軽平野にある。
sen.e: The farthest place of the expansion of Sueki production can be seen at Goshogawara kiln in Tsugaru Plain which was in operation from the end of the ninth century to the tenth century.
The farthest place of the expansion of Sueki production can be seen at Goshogawara kiln in Tsugaru Plain which was in operation from the end of the ninth century to the tenth century.
The farthest place of the expansion of Sueki production can be seen at Goshogawara kiln in Tsugaru Plain which was in operation from the end of the ninth century to the tenth century.

sen.j: 当時日本の支配領域の外か外縁にあった五所川原窯からは、地元の津軽半島だけでなく、北海道まで製品が送り出された。
sen.e: Since Goshogawara kiln was at the outer edge or the outside of the territory dominated by Japan, Sueki products were sent not only to local Tsugaru Peninsula but also to Hokkaido.
Since Goshogawara kiln was at the outer edge or the outside of the territory dominated by Japan, Sueki products were sent not only to local Tsugaru Peninsula but also to Hokkaido.
Since Goshogawara kiln was at the outer edge or the outside of the territory dominated by Japan, Sueki products were sent not only to local Tsugaru Peninsula but also to Hokkaido.
